actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Judiciary.
Subcommittee on Courts. Hearings held. Hearings printed:  S.Hrg. 98-860.

official_title: A bill to amend title 28, United States Code, to divide the ninth judicial circuit of the United States into two circuits, and for other purposes.
short_title: Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals Reorganization Act of 1983

summary.text: Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals Reorganization Act of 1983 - Divides the Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals and creates a Twelfth Circuit, comprising Alaska, Idaho, Montana, Oregon, and Washington. Reassigns former Ninth Circuit judges to the new circuits. Permits specified senior judges of the former Ninth Circuit to elect assignments in either the Ninth or Twelfth Circuit. Establishes guidelines for the disposition of proceedings commenced in the former Ninth Circuit.

titles.title: Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals Reorganization Act of 1983
A bill to amend title 28, United States Code, to divide the ninth judicial circuit of the United States into two circuits, and for other purposes.
